text: Field, British Columbia is an unincorporated town with about 169 people located in the Kicking Horse River valley of British Columbia, Canada in Yoho National Park. It is about in elevation. It is around west of Lake Louise on the Trans-Canada Highway, which is the only road to the town. It is named after Cyrus West Field of Transatlantic telegraph cable fame, who explored the area in 1884. == References == Category:Settlements in British Columbia
title: Field, British Columbia
